snippet.title: SRB2 2D for DOS!
snippet.description:
In 1999, Stealth, more commonly known for his work on Sonic Mania more recently, had been working with Sonic Team Junior to create a game engine for Sonic Robo Blast 2 written in C based on the original TGF development version.

However, a suggestion to move SRB2 over to a 3D engine caught the attention of Sonikku at the time, and a 2D Sonic Robo Blast 2 would cease to be which at the time frustrated Stealth into leaving STJr for the rest of time, leaving this proof of concept on his personal website on February 2nd, 1999.

Plenty of progress had been made on this engine before being scrapped. While the engine is only slightly less jank than SRB2 TGF and even then the original SRB, including a working spin dash, and multiple powerups both from proper Sonic games and one original shield power.

Sadly, the game ends at Green Flower Zone 3 with a single Crawla and nothing else to show. Many menus either drop you back into the main menu or end up in a placeholder screen.

You can find an archive of SRB2 2D, along with an early port of SRB1, here: https://mega.nz/#!MDpRhCjK!w4NJH8YxnU2Wq6gdjsKfBEBcUgC2l0vFhxNGPMu3bXo
